column5: I am not sure if it was a wise decision but I decided to take the 2 out of my 3 daughters onto the ice today on Simcoe.  Things worked out better than anticipated. I think those 2 cold nights last week really firmed things up. There is still a good 2.5" of ice out there.  Just be careful, there are a few larger cracks starting to open up. I took a pic of the girls on the ice.  The girls probably should have been wearing survival suits but they probably would have got heat stroke due to the 19 degree temps outside.
Looks safe to me. Where's your fishin' gear?  They're still hauling 60,000 ton loads on our ice.
Good of you to have the young ladies go on the ice bare footed. It will get them used to the cold tile floors in the kitchen. That's what I call 'future planning'.
Now that's some quality time with the fam..  I was half expecting a fishing report!!  cheers HD
Because of this fine report Chris , think i'll take a drive down there this morning and see how much longer before i need to get the boat ready .
I wish folks would blur out the background, that spot will be a zoo this weekend.     oh oh.... them fight'n words. lol
I have'nt check yet , but do you think the bay will be full of boats this weekend ???????or the beach full of people .
~~~I know I'm going to be out there, as to where I'm launching, good question, Will be looking at Sib first moving west till we find a ramp
It is good to hear from you Cudz! I hope that you are enjoying your break. Jim

lol.  I doubt it.  Neiter of them can figure out how to clean or cook. Actually the one the right can make kraft dinner.  SHe has a crazy temper and fights all the time.  Good luck to the poor soul who gets that for the rest of his life.  lol.  Kraft dinner and beatings for him.
